title: Science of skincare: what is zinc oxide and how does it help your skin?
text:
Zinc oxide isn’t an ingredient you usually hear about a lot, but it is essential in your sun cream and blemish creams. We teamed up with cosmetic dermatologist Dr Sam Bunting to find out what it is and why it’s so important to have zinc oxide in your bathroom cabinet.

What is zinc oxide?

In its most natural state zinc oxide is a white, powdery mineral used for plastic and various textiles and beauty products. It’s one of the key ingredients in your sun cream.

What are the benefits of zinc oxide vs. chemical suncreams?

While zinc oxide creates a protective barrier and deflects UV rays off of your skin (both UVA and UVB), chemical SPF absorbs them before they can cause any harm. Chemical formulas can cause some irritation if you have sensitive skin, but they are virtually invisible. Physical SPFs have a reputation for being chalky, but it’s worth trying out the newer formulas as they’re much lighter.

Zinc oxide has also been shown to help reduce acne as it soothes skin and eases inflammation. It’s usually included in nappy creams.
